body.name: Easyfone Prime-A6 4G Unlocked Feature Cell Phone, Easy-to-Use Clear Sound GSM Dumbphone with an Easy Charging Dock
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 15 hrs
features: Clear and loud sound; Easy-to-Use operating system.
Classic bar-type cell phone focus on calling and texting, No Internet access and without camera.
1050mAh real capacity battery with an easy charging dock, Long time standby and easy to charge.
Additional SOS button; Eight Speed dial buttons (8 number keys can be set as dedicated direct dial keys).
Multi useful functions: FM Radio, Alarm clock, MP3 Player, Notes, Calculator, Calendar, Bluetooth, Flashlight, SOS feature and Speed dial.

Unlocked to T-Mobile, MetroPCS, SpeedTalk and Tello Mobile, This phone work great with SpeedTalk (SIM Card Included) which running on T-Mobile network, Variety of plans starting at $5 a month, Option for Keep your existing phone number or Get a New phone number.
Please note that this phone is NOT compatible with AT&T, Cricket or with CDMA Networks like Verizon, Sprint, and Boost Mobile.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Easyfone Prime-A6 is an unlocked 4G feature cell phone, This phone has good looking & holding design w/ Clear sound and Big battery for long time standby; True talk and text phone, No Internet access, It's a perfect phone for seniors or kids or just want a reliable and simple phone for daily use.

***4G Unlocked to T-Mobile, MetroPCS, SpeedTalk and Tello Mobile***This phone come with a new SpeedTalk SIM Card which running on T-Mobile network. Variety of plans for choose***This phone is NOT Compatible with AT&T, Cricket or with CDMA Networks like Verizon, Sprint, and Boost Mobile***

Previous page Classic Bar Phone Focus on Call & Text, Keep in Touch w/ Family Easier operating system w/ clear sound focus on call & Text No internet access keep life simple Easy to Dialing Big Buttons for Easy Dial & Can be Set Speed Dial Easily to call your favourite contacts with speed dial Big size buttons with button speech feature Easy Charging Big Battery for Long Time Standby w/ Charging Dock Big size charging dock for charging easily Optimized EC mode w/1050mAh battery for long time standby Easy for Help Additional SOS Button for Easier to Ask for Help SOS Call & message send to each 5 SOS contacts If No Need, User can turn off this feature in Setting More features Customised useful Features for daily need All features customised for easier to use Next page 1 Easy-to-Use Cell Phone 2 Big Buttons & Speed Dial 3 Good Battery Life 4 Emergency SOS Button 5 Addt'l Useful Features

Suitable for different scenes and people Senior Citizens Big button, Big font & Clear SoundSimple OS for easy to useCharging dock for easy chargingSpeed dial for easy dialingSOS Button for emergency help Kids & Students No internet accessCalls and Messages OnlySOS button keep their safeSpeed dial calls feature great for kids who can't read yet Use as Backup Phone Simple operation system easy to useSmall size and lightBig battery & long time standbyMinimalist phone avoid internet attack Travel Overseas 2G GSM unlocked for all countries with GSM network coverageCheap and basic functionSmall size and lightBig battery & long time standby

Product Function Presentation Video of Prime-A6 Regarding the video you may have question about How to Set up Speed Dial?---Firstly, Save the contacts to Phonebook; Then go to the Speed Dial menu(Menu - Tool - Speed dial) and Add target contact to speed dial list and you all set.

Product Specification Details: Display Screen 1.8 inches TFT HD Speaker & Receiver Φ26mm Big Speaker & AAC HAC Receiver Cellular Technology 4G, 4G VoLTE, 3G WCDMA, 2G GSM (GSM Quad-Bands) Device Language Support English, Spanish, French, German, Italian, Arabic Talking Time & Standby Time 5.5 hours & 96+ hours Sim Card Request 1* Nano size sim card (Include a SpeedTalk SIM card, Plan starting at 5USD a month) Micro-SD Card Support up to 16G (Not include) Battery 1050mAh Real Capacity Battery Bluetooth Yes, Bluetooth 5.0 Hearing Aid Compatible Yes, M4/T4 Phonebook Capacity 500 Contacts Phone & Box Weight 82g & 326g Phone & Box Size 11.5 x 5.2 x 1.45 cm & 13.6 x 11.8 x 6.25 cm Headset connector Type 3.5 mm Input Method Abc input (Not support T9) Internet Browser Not support

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WILL activate on AT&T SIM card
reviews.reviewText: It is NOT easy to find a phone that can make calls and text that is incapable of accessing the web in any way. This is one such phone.I bought a Kyocera flip phone, but it had creepy firmware/ spyware terms you had to agree to for the device to function. Other basic phones often also come preloaded with its YouTube or Facebook apps that cannot be removed. Tricky!I added a line to my phone plan, and my local AT&T store installed a SIM card for me, free of charge, and it connects to 4G. It’s like a candy bar phone from 1997. Feels like a toy in your hand, but the battery lasts a long time, and NO internet access of any kind. It’s not even capable of running apps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Useless! Which is a shame, because it is simple to use when it works.
reviews.reviewText: At first it seemed like a decent, easy to use phone, but it didn't take look for it to show full bars but 'Emergency calls only'. The provider can see and ping the phone, but the phone can't be used. Tested with different SIM cards but with the same result. Also, there are several spelling mistakes in the OS. When it does work, the call quality was awful.It's a shame, because the phone is very easy to use for elderly people, such as my mother in law and the charging cradle is handy because you don't have to fiddle with plugging in a cord. For such a simple phone, the battery life is also relatively short (less than two days with no usage). There was a second battery in the box, but as hard as it is to open the back cover, I can't see my mother in law figuring that out. The bad part of that is also that when you remove the battery (or it dies), the phone loses settings like time and date, which it should get from the network anyway!Needless to say, i'm sending it back and I would NOT recommend this phone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It ain't a 747 or an X-15, but it is efficient.
reviews.reviewText: The phone is marketed as suitable for "seniors," presumably because the stereotype is that many of them have been reduced to being fumbling dolts. Of course, I dispute this broad brush generalization. With that I will say that the phone is easy to use and easy to read for anyone. It has a strong signal and very good reception of weak incoming signals. Fact is that I hate carrying a heavy, oversized so-called "smart phone around all day. The EasyPhone is light weight, attractive and compact, all of which are the reasons I like it. It's one significant drawback is that it does not have a camera. But then I'm not Ansel Adams or Steven Spielberg, so I don't make my livelihood shooting pictures. All in all, I like the phone and recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hands down best basic voice phone I've ever used
reviews.reviewText: For those leaving 'bad' reviews for this great little phone, I suggest go back to your iPhone. This phone is a simple voice and text phone only, and why it's so great to me. It was a breeze to set up and took 30 seconds. Receiving and making calls works great, has fabulous clarity and voice quality. I don't understand the negative reviews and how people say it's hard to use or doesn't make or receive calls well. It's not true. Works with Tello for $5 per month voice only plan. Beautiful and simple design. Phone turns on in 10 seconds.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Non-intuitive and low quality.
reviews.reviewText: I got this for my daughter as a first phone. Navigating through the menus is tedious at best. Text messages are several menu layers in, while a calendar and task list is prioritized with one click.All these issues are a moot point since the mic stopped working after a few weeks of use.Don't waste your money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good but kind of difficult and hard to instability. Card.
reviews.reviewText: This is a fairly initial review of the Easyfone A1 Prime. The charge cradle is good and charges up the phone well, but the cradle is light and the cord could have been somewhat longer. I like how perfectly it fits in the palm of my hand. It came with slots where you could put it on a lanyard. It does come with one but I have a feeling it won't be long enough. Whenever I buy something, I try to find the PDF manual for it. It's quite hard unless you pay for it online OR find it where it's greatly stretched out. It's quite hard to figure out how to do certain parts I caps. The EASIEST is to put your contacts in ALL caps or have one cap only with small letters forthcoming. Yes, it does have a hard copy of the manual but even that can't help you figure it out. You can email them in INDIA. Oh yes, India. I myself will use it with a carrier I want as it's unlocked. The infinitesimal wallpapers and choice of ringtones are limited. Lastly, you may be able to get online with it but I wouldn't get it for that in case it doesn't work. I kept trying to figure out how to use the phone, and I ran into problems trying to install the SIM card. The chosen carrier I chose sent me SIM cards, but based on the pictures in the manual weren’t true to how the compartment opened up for it to be loaded. I am sending it back. I had two types of SIM cards and neither seemingly worked.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what we were looking for!
reviews.reviewText: It is so hard to find a reasonable phone for our kids that has only talk + text. No internet, no apps, no games. We found and tried this and have been very pleased. It is our “home phone” and is exactly what we were looking for our home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for seniors (but could be improved)
reviews.reviewText: This phone is built of flimsy material and the battery compartment lid actually bends as you push to slide it out. I got the red version and discovered that red is not the colour of the plastic, but instead, was sprayed on top of the black colour and the imperfect overspray is visible on the inside of the lid cover (but not the outside where it looks perfect|).Having said this, the features and ease of use of this phone is exactly what my elderly mother needed. The screen display could be magnified for easy viewing with the huge numbers, and when combined with the audio reading of each number pressed (if set for this), makes if it impossible for seniors to make a mistake when dialing numbers. The phone is also light and comes with a neckstap so that you can wear the phone like a necklace which prevents seniors from dropping the phone or misplacing it. Overall, extremely easy for senors to use, and very easy to set using the simple menu list.However, there are two horrible features, both of which can be deactivated from the phone's menau. First, the phone comes with a flashlight feature which is switched on (and drains the battery) far too easily by inadvertently touching the on/off button located on the side of the phone. Second, there is an FM radio feature which you need to switch off in the menu otherwise it'll cause you massive grief. Not sure why such a retarded feature which nobody on earth will ever use was added to the phone,Apart from these two features, the phone is absolutely phenominal, my mother loves it, and I would highly recommend it

reviews.reviewTitle: PHONE DOES NOT WORK ON MY NETWORK
reviews.reviewText: Hi, the phone I purchased does not work on my network, I cannot receive or make calls. Your advertisement said it was unlocked but it does not work on the DODO network.I would like a refund !!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Get your duds in a row
reviews.reviewText: --and contemplate the probability of three defective Easy phones in quick succession, in light of dozens of positive reviews: " ... super easy ...happy with ... real bargain ... perfect phone ... best money that I have ever spent". Jeez! Not having purchased, or even used, any cell phone before venturing on this one, our approach was both punctilious and, in retrospect, lamentably authoritarian. The first one could not be programmed; we struggled with it ..."must be our fault ... actually, not ..." before sending it back, happily within the return time. The second one (I did say authoritarian) continually would not switch on; for a while we thought that having to push buttons all over the place to activate the damn thing was normal operation -- but finally both we, and it, quit altogether. Having returned this one, we ordered a third (yes...), which lasted longer than the second, and then conveniently died in the same way, just outside the return window.During this finally expensive, admittedly educational saga, this deceptively fine-looking phone -- always a sucker for red -- let us down, crucially, on two emergency calls, and one other important enough to be a significant inconvenience. We make no claim to being techies, in the contemporary sense, but do expect that putting a fair amount of time and effort into learning how to use an unfamiliar unit will yield something reliable in operation. This parade of shoddy phones was an unsettling let-down.Having contemplated whether it was actually worth it to us to try again (..."couldn't we figure out something with the laptop, dear?"), we have -- with a Ushining cell phone, also from Amazon. Appearances can always be deceptive, it appears -- this model looks very much like the uneasy phone (red!), but is conveniently a tad bigger, works in the same putative way, is less expensive and, most salient, has been one hundred percent reliable in operation for over two months now.I rarely give only one star in a review, but this one for the uneasy phone should be halved. At the same time, I salute the many who seem to have had success with it; I just hope this continues for them. Marcus W.

I bought this phone for my 83 year old mother. She loves how easy it is to use with its big buttons. But after 7 months, the ringer stopped working and shortly thereafter, the entire phone stopped functioning. I immediately contacted the vendor who promptly sent a replacement phone by mail. Since the replacement came directly from China, and given Covid19-related delays, it took about a month to arrive, but that was out of their control. My mother is happy to have a working phone and I appreciate the great service I received.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far, a simple great phone.
reviews.reviewText: Arrived quickly and safely via Amazon Prime. Needed a very simple phone that operates on a minimum 3G network and sadly the phone manufacturers only want us to use smart-phones which are way to technical for some people. The Easyphone Prime works on a 3G network (we really have to hope that 3G continues !!) and it is basically a flip-phone. Great for anyone who does not want hi-tech, who wants that simple convenience , and what's better than a flip-phone to carry around ???? Reduced stars for battery life because not yet fully tested - BUT NOTE Easyphone came with extra battery; and it does not have a touch screen, and this might be the greatest downside as reaching some of the phones extras requires using buttons and arrows and might be detrimental for the seniors the phone is aimed at. Other than that, so far (and it is early days) this is a great and simple to use phone.
